args:
When word of Satan's revival finds the prince,
he races to Grams with his friends. After razing
the holy city, Satan goes dormant, giving them
and the apostles time to tend the wounded and
formulate a new plan.
I feared an existence with no hope of happiness.\nI wanted to protect this world of possibilities.\nAnd yet...

There is nothing you can do. Now witness
the crumbling of this world from the finest
seats in the house. The stage is yours,
my lord!
(It's been nearly 12 hours since Satan's\nreturn, and I don't know how many more\nhours I'll live to see.)
The evacuation site is still a bit chaotic,\nbut the local watchmen are doing the\nrounds and calming things down.
As for the search for survivors...
We have picked up a few more here in the\ncity, and I have Aeleen and Ricardt tending\nthe wounded as we speak.
(On our way back from Rozcimea to\nGrams, Nevin asked Ramiel to take care\nof a certain matter.)
Fine, though between the time they'll need\nto prepare and time spent on the road,\nsome degree of lag is unavoidable.
(It was to track down the landship carrying\nthe seventh scion and request aid.)

(After locating the ship, Ramiel asked
the denizens of the Halidom who had
remained aboard to help stop
Satan's revival.)
(Though Alberia and Grams have an\nuneasy relationship, they saw the gravity\nof the situation and answered our call.)
The Halidom's backup is really saving our\nheinies here, so Papa Bear had better get\nout there and carry his weight.
Last thing I need is his ghost\ncoming back just to nag me.
Good news, everyone: The prince and his\nentourage are en route to Grams.
What? Weren't they in the\nFaerie Kingdom?
Yes. A faerie messenger just arrived\nto let us know.
Apparently even all the way out there, the\nfaeries sensed Satan's revival, which is\nhow {player_name} heard of it.
Sounds like the faeries are going to use\nsome kind of secret technique to send\nthem our way.
This is great—we're nearly there already.
And in the blink of an eye! Man, this\nfaerie magic is WILD—er, which I\nguess means I'm wild too?
We've not the time to stand in wonder;\nI sense something sinister just beyond\nthe outer wall.
Hey, thanks for coming to get us!
The faeries told me the Demonlord has\ndescended on Grams. Is it true?
Right then. What's the current situation?
By the Goddess... What happened here?
Grams was razed by Satan moments\nafter his rebirth.
Nearly the entire city is gone,\nsave for the slums on the outskirts.
We've been sheltering what few survivors\nwe can find there.
North of the city. He appears to have\nentered a sort of stasis.
He is frozen in place. Unmoving.\nMost likely just gathering his strength.
Which means this is our chance to get\nhim, right? I mean, the big jerk's just\nsitting there, so let's go kick his butt!
I'm afraid that's not possible. He's surrounded\nby miasma too dense to dispel with holy water.
Any who charge in will become frenzied,\nand may even be transformed into\ndemonic entities.
If I may, why did he enter this stasis\nto begin with?
Eyes on! We've got fiends incoming.
With the city in this state, there's nothing\nto stop them from getting in...
We can celebrate the reunion later.\nRight now, we need to get these people\nout of here.
Yes, and we need to escort them to the\nevacuation site. Can I ask your assistance\nin this, Prince {player_name}?
I'm Regina, the apostles' commander.\nI've heard a lot of reports about you.
We're happy to help with anything we can,\nso don't hesitate to ask.
＂Anything＂ is a very generous offer.\nSadly, there's not much any of us\ncan do at present.
Like Pinon said, ol' Big and Ugly is\nshrouded in miasma, which means\nthere's no way to get at him.
And while he's behaving for now, it's only\na matter of time before he decides to go\non the warpath again.
Best we can do is get every survivor\nwe can find to the evacuation site.
But Satan is still hanging out in Grams,\nyeah? So wouldn't it be better to get\nthe survivors outta here altogether?
I'd love to, but as yet no one has agreed\nto take them in. It's too dangerous to send\nthem across the border right now.

The king of Grams and Archbishop Basel
are in talks with surrounding nations to
accept the refugees, but I'm not going
to hold my breath on that.
Things up here in the north are unstable\nthese days, so the idea of taking in a ton\nof refugees probably isn't very appealing.
Your king should make the same request\nof New Alberia.
Oh? I was under the impression the two\nnations weren't on the best of terms.
No matter the history, I can't just stand by\nand do nothing when Grams's people are\nin danger.
Besides which, humanitarian aid can be\ngood business. Everyone likes cutting\ndeals with a friendly neighbor.
I'll lend you my Gran Fiore to transport them.\nIt should have enough room to accommodate\neveryone.
Hey, so where did all the angels go?
I'll take it from here, Pinon.
No, please. I think putting it into words\nwill help me accept it.
Gabriel is... All of the angels are gone.\nDestroyed in the battle with Satan.
